channel.title: Lol stupid "PW shit" from czar
channel.description:
on czar it makes your passwords into 4653-.4363-463-46-34.6-43-643-6-45 and fuck like that so i want to use the accounts from my old server to my new server witch not is czar based so i copied from /*if i ever need a hoster i dont have to worry about PW shit*/ to ////////END OF CRYPTION
i get this error : [code]client.java:9347: cannot find symbol symbol : class MessageDigest location: class client MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance( "MD5" ); ^ client.java:9347: cannot find symbol symbol : variable MessageDigest location: class client MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance( "MD5" ); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully! [/code]
so how do i fix it ? stupid czar pw shit

item.title: Lol stupid "PW shit" from czar
item.dc:creator: @vato vato
item.description:
@vato wrote:

ok heres what you do.
first before you do it, i want you to know, that any existing accs passes, will be wrong.
i suggest deleting your char file, then doing this.

anyways
search for this

String hashPW = md5(playerPass);

then, you should see this

String hashPW = md5(playerPass); playerPass = hashPW;

add two of these "//"before each, to make it like this

//String hashPW = md5(playerPass); //playerPass = hashPW;

save, compile, and done you have non encripted passes.

Read full topic

Every starts out new at everything, Thats a simple explanation Why i hate the word “noob”.

You gotta declare the handler under the implements thing.

item.title: Lol stupid "PW shit" from czar
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

HazzardScape:

lol u have 21 rep and u dont no how to fix error lol (its in your client.java just search for MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance( “MD5” ); and deleat it[/quote][quote=“bobsisland, post:5, topic:201920”]lol !!! your rep points have nothing to do with how to fix stuff on java. anyways if i deleted that it wouldnt work lol…

Both of you newbies shut up.

The “Cannot find symbol” error means that you must DECLARE that handler under “Implements Runnable”
(Should be the 7th or so line of your client.java)

Read full topic
